definition: to tidy up/to reorganize/to consolidate/to rectify
exactly/in good order/whole/complete/entire/in order/orderly/to repair/to mend/to renovate/(coll.) to fix sb/to give sb a hard time/to mess with sb
to stop/to pause/to arrange/to lay out/to kowtow/to stamp (one's foot)/at once/classifier for meals, beatings, scoldings etc: time, bout, spell, meal

sentences.english: The reorganization plan of the enterprise shall be discussed by the congress of the staff and workers of the enterprise.
sentences.chinese: 企业整顿方案应当经过企业职工代表大会讨论。

sentences.english: Best straighten up for a longer legacy.
sentences.chinese: 最好的整顿较长的遗产。

sentences.english: Roy:Apparently, getting your ass kicked is now a part of this complete breakfast.
sentences.chinese: 看起来，被打得稀里哗啦会是你整顿早饭的一部分了。

sentences.english: Never clear off your desk by randomly throwing things in a drawer.
sentences.chinese: 不要为了收拾整顿你的桌子而随便把东西扔进抽斗里。

sentences.english: Cameroon Ministry of Communications has also ordered three companies of informal long-distance passenger business for rectification.
sentences.chinese: 喀交通部还勒令三家非正规长途客运公司停业整顿。

sentences.english: We should put the society in order.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须整顿社会秩序。

sentences.english: To rectify the Party's style of work and improve social conduct, we should start with the senior cadres.
sentences.chinese: 为了整顿党风，搞好民风，先要从我们高级干部整起。

sentences.english: The next day, the unit will be ordered to suspend business for reorganization.
sentences.chinese: 第二天，该单位将被勒令停业整顿业务。

sentences.english: With adim triumph, she trims the swimming-suit rim at the swimming-pool brim.
sentences.chinese: 她带着暗淡的喜悦在泳池边整顿泳装的边沿。

sentences.english: The government decided to neaten the real estate market.
sentences.chinese: 国家下决心整顿房产市场。

sentences.english: Chinese Premier Wen Jiabao said, "We will work to rectify and standarize the real estate market.
sentences.chinese: 他还说，我们将整顿规范房地产市场。

sentences.english: A number of securities companies were closed or temporary closed for reorganizing because of irregular operations.
sentences.chinese: 部分证券公司因违规经营被撤销或停业整顿。

sentences.english: To be responsible for the rectification and closure of coal mines.
sentences.chinese: 负责指导煤矿整顿关闭工作。

sentences.english: Supervising market orders is at the same time to supervise the government.
sentences.chinese: 治理整顿市场秩序的同时也要治理整顿政府自身。

sentences.english: Supervising market orders is at the same time to supervise the government.
sentences.chinese: 治理整顿市场秩序的同时也要治理整顿政府自身。

sentences.english: We will rectify and standardize the market order.
sentences.chinese: 整顿和规范市场经济秩序。

definition: strict/serious/solemn/dignified/to tidy up/to clean up/to purge/to adjust
to bring under control/to regulate/to restore to good condition/(coll.) to fix (a person)/to prepare (a meal etc)
to investigate thoroughly/to carefully inspect/to verify/to ferret out (undesirable elements)
to suppress/to crack down on/to prohibit
to issue (a memorandum etc) to lower levels/to distribute (e.g. disaster relief to victims)
to oversee/to take charge of/to supervise/to administer/supervisory/supervision
to try harder/to redouble one's efforts
to incorporate into one's troops/to weave in
to clear up/to tidy up/to dispose of
